item.title: Run Qiskit Code Assistant Locally easily!
item.description:
Donâ€™t have access to the Qiskit Code Assistant because youâ€™re not on an IBM Quantum Premium plan?

No worriesâ€”you can run it directly on your computer! Weâ€™ve recently improved the local setup experience. With our scripts, you can:

  • âœ… Download the LLM optimized for local enviroments (GGUF)
  • âœ… Enable inference on your machine (through Ollama)
  • âœ… Automatically configure the Qiskit Code Assistant VSCode or JupyterLab extension

Give it a try and share your feedbackâ€”weâ€™d love to hear how you use it!

More info: https://quantum.cloud.ibm.com/docs/en/guides/qiskit-code-assistant-local#quick-start-recommended

#Qiskit #QuantumComputing #AI #Ollama #OpenSource #AIforQuantum

item.title: Qiskit Code Assistant Upgraded to Mistral-Small-3.2-24B-Qiskit
item.description:
We’ve upgraded the Qiskit Code Assistant! ðŸš€

Last month, we introduced mistral-small-3.2-24b-qiskit, replacing granite-3.3-8b-qiskit.

Key Improvements

âœ… Better accuracy: The new model ranks higher across key benchmarks, including QiskitHumanEval, QiskitHumanEval Hard, HumanEval, MathQA, ASDiv, SciQ and others (see the model card for more info).

âœ… Improved UX: More precise responses for quantum programming tasks.

âœ… Open access: Available on Hugging Face â†’ https://huggingface.co/Qiskit/mistral-small-3.2-24b-qiskit.

This update is part of our mission to make quantum development more intuitive and efficient. ðŸŒŸ

Explore it, test it, and share your feedback!

#Qiskit #QuantumComputing #AI #OpenSource #HuggingFace

item.title: Qiskit Code Assistant: New Open-Source LLM Models Released
item.description:
ðŸš€ We’re thrilled to announce the latest open-source LLM releases from the Qiskit Code Assistant team! ðŸš€

These new models bring enhanced capabilities and broader compatibility to quantum computing development.

What’s New:

âœ¨ Qiskit 2.0 Compatibility - Our newer models are fully compatible with Qiskit 2.0 code, ensuring seamless development with the latest quantum computing framework

ðŸ§  Enhanced Text Understanding - Significant improvements in general text comprehension and code generation capabilities

ðŸ”¬ Expanding Our Horizons - We continue to leverage the newest stable versions of IBM Granite 3.2 and 3.3 models, while for the first time exploring beyond IBM Granite with the powerful Qwen2.5-Coder series

Available Models: â€¢ Granite 3.3 8B Qiskit (+ GGUF) â€¢ Granite 3.2 8B Qiskit (+ GGUF) â€¢ Qwen2.5-Coder 14B Qiskit (+ GGUF)

All models are available on Hugging Face and ready for local deployment!

ðŸ”— Browse All Models: https://huggingface.co/Qiskit ðŸ”— Get Started: https://quantum.cloud.ibm.com/docs/en/guides/qiskit-code-assistant-local

We’d love to hear how you’re making the most of these models! Share your experiences and quantum development journey with us. ðŸŒŸ

Big thanks to the team involved in this release, specially to Nicolas Dupuis, Adarsh Tiwari and Ismael Faro

item.title: Qiskit Code Assistant Now Compatible with OpenAI Completions API
item.description:
Exciting update! The Qiskit Code Assistant service now exposes compatible endpoints with OpenAI’s Completions API. This integration enables seamless usage via existing libraries (OpenAI, LiteLLM, etc.), making it easy to infuse Qiskit knowledge into your LLM pipelines.

Learn more: https://quantum.cloud.ibm.com/docs/en/guides/qiskit-code-assistant-openai-api

#qiskit #QiskitCodeAssistant #IBMQuantum #openai

Originally shared on LinkedIn on March 10, 2025 - 43 reactions, 0 comments as of 11/12/2025

item.title: Shipping Granite-8B-Qiskit-RC-0.10: The Final Model of Current Training Era
item.description:
ðŸš€ Last Friday, we shipped something special: granite-8b-qiskit-rc-0.10, our latest revision of the LLMs that empower the Qiskit Code Assistant.

Trained on a significantly expanded Qiskit synthetic dataset, this release marks the end of an era - it’s our final model using the current training approach.

What’s next? We’re pivoting to newer Granite base models and starting to integrate other cutting-edge techniques. Stay tuned!

Check it out: https://huggingface.co/Qiskit/granite-8b-qiskit-rc-0.10

#Qiskit #QuantumComputing #AI #AIforQuantum #QiskitCodeAssistant

Originally shared on LinkedIn on February 18, 2025 - 126 reactions, 8 comments as of 11/12/2025

item.title: Quantum Developer Conference 2024: Showcasing AI-Powered Quantum Tools
item.description:
Excited to be participating in the Quantum Developer Conference 2024 at the IBM Thomas J. Watson Research Center! It’s been fantastic networking with fellow quantum computing professionals and showcasing the latest developments at the intersection of AI and quantum computing.

We’re featuring exciting innovations including the Qiskit Code Assistant and our cutting-edge AI-powered transpiler passes. These tools represent significant steps forward in making quantum computing more accessible and efficient.

Learn more: https://www.ibm.com/quantum/blog/qdc-2024

#QuantumComputing #AI #IBMQuantum #AIforQuantum

Originally shared on LinkedIn on November 15, 2024 - 97 reactions, 1 comment as of 11/12/2025

item.title: Introducing Qiskit Code Assistant: New Blog Post Published
item.description:
Last week we published a blog post summarizing what is the Qiskit Code Assistant and how you can start to use it.

Following the recent launch, users are already leveraging the tool’s features. We’re actively developing improved models with enhanced capabilities that we’re planning to release as open source!

Read the blog post: https://www.ibm.com/quantum/blog/qiskit-code-assistant

#qiskit #qiskitcodeassistant #opensource #ibmquantum

Originally shared on LinkedIn on October 15, 2024 - 51 reactions, 0 comments as of 11/12/2025

item.title: IEEE Quantum Week 2024: Showcasing AI-Powered Quantum Tools
item.description:
Las week I attended to the IEEE Quantum Week and it was a blast! ðŸš€ðŸ”¬

I had the opportunity to witness and showcase several groundbreaking developments from IBM Quantum AI:

ðŸ”¹ Qiskit Transpiler Service: Jay Gambetta presented impressive results showing how our AI-powered optimization passes outperformed all competitors in benchpress regarding depth and number of gates, including Qiskit itself!

ðŸ”¹ Qiskit Code Assistant: We announced the first preview release of this innovative tool.

ðŸ”¹ Unitary Compilation Research: David Kremer presented our work on approximate compiling of unitaries in quantum circuits using AI. We also co-delivered a tutorial on AI-powered transpiler passes.

ðŸ”¹ Qiskit HumanEval: I had the chance to present this benchmark for evaluating quantum software development tools.

It was an incredible week of innovation, collaboration, and pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in quantum computing!

#QuantumComputing #IEEEQuantumWeek #Qiskit #AIforQuantum #QisktiCodeAssistant #QiskitTranspilerService #ResearchHighlights

Originally shared on LinkedIn on September 24, 2024 - 71 reactions, 0 comments as of 11/12/2025

item.title: Optimize Quantum Circuits with AI-Powered Transpiler Passes
item.description:
Exciting updates from our team at the convergence of AI and quantum computing! ðŸš€

We have released a bunch of new features in the Qiskit transpiler service and the Qiskit Code Assistant projects that continue unlocking the potential of applying classical AI into Quantum computing.

Recent releases include: ðŸ”¹ Beta version of the Qiskit transpiler service (unveiled at #THINK24) ðŸ”¹ Research paper on AI methods enabling AI-powered transpiler passes ðŸ”¹ Qiskit Code Assistant with accompanying paper introducing LLMs and the Qiskit HumanEval benchmark

Both projects have received recognition through the IBM Quantum Challenge, with fantastic feedback from participants who got to experience the power of AI-driven quantum optimization firsthand!

This work represents a major step forward in making quantum computing more efficient and accessible through the integration of artificial intelligence.

Original post: https://www.ibm.com/quantum/blog/ai-transpiler-passes

Originally shared on LinkedIn on June 17, 2024 - 39 reactions, 1 comment as of 11/12/2025

item.title: Qiskit Code Assistant: Training LLMs for Quantum Code Generation Paper Published
item.description:
Excited to share our research paper on training specialized LLMs for quantum computing code generation using Qiskit! ðŸš€

Code Large Language Models have emerged as powerful tools, revolutionizing the software development landscape by automating coding tasks. However, quantum programming presents unique challenges compared to classical coding.

Our work addresses:

  • The scarcity of quantum code examples
  • The rapidly evolving nature of the quantum computing field
  • Custom benchmarking similar to HumanEval for quantum-specific tasks

The results are promising: our model outperforms existing state-of-the-art quantum computing models!

This research represents an important step toward making quantum programming more accessible through AI assistance.

Read the paper: https://arxiv.org/abs/2405.19495v1

#qiskit #genAI #codegen #LLMs #IBMQuantum

Originally shared on LinkedIn on June 17, 2024 - 45 reactions, 3 comments as of 11/12/2025

item.title: Qiskit SDK v1.0 Released: Including Qiskit Transpiler and Code Assistant
item.description:
I’m extremely proud of this massive release including two projects from my team: the Qiskit Transpiler (with the AI transpiling passes) and the Qiskit Code Assistant ðŸš€

Qiskit SDK 1.x represents full-stack software for all things quantum, featuring:

  • Qiskit Transpiler with AI-powered optimization
  • Qiskit Runtime
  • Qiskit Serverless
  • AI Code Assistant

More updates and info coming soon!

Context: In response to IBM Quantum’s post announcing Qiskit SDK v1.0, introducing the full-stack software for quantum computing with Qiskit Transpiler, Qiskit Runtime, Qiskit Serverless, and the AI Code Assistant.

Originally shared on LinkedIn on May 16, 2024 - 15 reactions, 0 comments as of 11/12/2025
